intro: Dasiphora reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the rose family (Rosaceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the stems are covered with fine, hairy glands. Dasiphora reticulata is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in alpine and subalpine zones.
